definition: to banish/to deport/to send into exile/to be marooned
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: Those whom God leaves out of selection he is also reproving, and for no other reason than that he wills to exclude them.
sentences.chinese: 上帝如果不揀選你，沒有別的原因，他就是把你放逐。

sentences.english: The statesman is ostracize because he betray many top secrets.
sentences.chinese: 那個政治家因泄漏許多國家最高機密而被放逐。

sentences.english: Myr Welder has all activated abilities of all cards exiled with it.
sentences.chinese: 祕耳焊工具有所有被它放逐之牌的所有起動式異能。

sentences.english: It was where the Romans put the criminals they did not want to escape.
sentences.chinese: 這是羅馬政府放逐囚犯的地方以免他們逃走。

sentences.english: I ostracize my right to express when I feel it's time.
sentences.chinese: 當我感到實際到來的時候將我的權利放逐出來。

sentences.english: He had been proscribed, a wanderer, poor.
sentences.chinese: 他曾被放逐，四處奔波，窮苦。

sentences.english: He was exiled to a distant land.
sentences.chinese: 他被放逐到一個很遠的地方。

sentences.english: An exile in the way Of love, like Hafiz.
sentences.chinese: 就象哈菲茲，在愛的路上被放逐。

sentences.english: Napoleon's exile to Elba was brief.
sentences.chinese: 拿破崙被放逐到厄爾巴島的時間很短。

sentences.english: No matter whether don't banish too fast as it cannot be helped, too fast.
sentences.chinese: 不管是否出於無奈，不要放逐的太快太快。

sentences.english: The Inughuit, however, are already a people in exile.
sentences.chinese: 然而，極地因紐特人早已被放逐了。

sentences.english: Whether out of helpless, don't banish too fast too fast.
sentences.chinese: 不管是否出於ˀ萜無奈，不要放逐的太快太快。

sentences.english: The colonel rebelled in protest over his transfer, saying it amounted to exile .
sentences.chinese: 上校抗命，反對調動，說調動無異於放逐。

sentences.english: John was a prisoner on Patmos because he was preaching about Jesus and that He had been raised from the dead.
sentences.chinese: 約翰被放逐到拔摩島因爲他傳說基督並他從死裏復活。

sentences.english: It has been asked, "What are maleficarum?"
sentences.chinese: 有人問道，“什麼是放逐法師？

sentences.english: Silence is a form of emotional banishment.

definition: to degrade/to degenerate/to become depraved/corrupt/a fall from grace
to imprison/to place under house arrest
to wander/to roam about/to loaf about/to be idle
left to return to unchecked growth/overgrown/grown wild
to sink into (vice, depravity etc)/to pass into oblivion/downfall/passing
extermination of an entire family (ancient Chinese punishment)
